input.label: Instruction for Enumerators 1. Introduce yourself and objectives of the survey 2. Ask the respondent whether she/he is engaged in trading sheep/goat and if YES ask her/his willingness to spare about one hour with you.

We are from International Center for Agricultural Research in Dry Areas and International Livestock Research Institute. These two institutions are going to work on the development of sheep/goat value chain in your area with the purpose of improving the wellbeing of female and male smallholder households and other value chain actors including traders, input suppliers, processors, transporters and consumers through improved income and nutrition. We would like to know the current status of sheep and goat production, input supply, marketing, processing and consumption in order to be able to measure changes over time after our interventions. For this purpose, we are interviewing randomly selected households and firms who keep sheep/ goats or process or market them or provide other services. Your business firm is one of these randomly selected firms and we would like to talk to you. The interview will take about 1 hour. All the information we obtain will remain strictly confidential and your answers will never be shared with anyone other than our team.
May I start now?

select1.label: A. Did the household consent to the interview?

item.label: Respondent does not have the time
Household head (or other knowledgeable member) is not present at the house

input.label: A2. Household GPS Coordinates:
input.hint: GPS coordinates can only be collected when outside.

select1.label: A16: Intervention status of the Kebele:

item.label: Male headed – the head is around
Male headed – the head is not around
Female headed – the head is around
Female headed – the head is not around

select1.label: A21. Relationship of survey respondent to Household Head

input.label: Section B: Species Inputs and Services

group.label: List and rank in terms of importance in total business income

select1.label: B1. Specify Input and Service Types:

item.label: Oil seed cakes (linseed, nouge, cotton seed, etc.)
Crop residues (wheat, tef, barley, pulses, Stover etc.)

input.label: Section C: Input purchases arrangement with suppliers

group.label: Indicate the following input purchasing details in the table below for the last 12 months

select.label: C3.1. Month of purchase for the Smallest Volume:
C3.2. Month of purchase for the Largest Volume:

item.label: buyer pays after set period of time (week or month)

input.label: Section D: Input sales and marketing arrangement with buyers

group.label: Indicate the following details about input sales in the table below for the last 12 months.

select.label: D3.1. Month of sales for the Smallest Volume:
D3.2. Month of sales for the Largest Volume:

input.label: E1. What is your approximate transaction costs per month for Labor?
E1. What is your approximate transaction costs per month for House rent (storage)?
E1. What is your approximate transaction costs per month for Telephone?
E1. What is your approximate transaction costs per month for Transportation?
E1. What is your approximate transaction costs per month for Taxes?
E1. What is your approximate transaction costs per month for Miscelleneous costs?
E2. For how many months do you do business in a year?

select1.label: E3. Is the total cost/unit increasing, decreasing or same compared to 5 yrs ago?
E4. Do you trade in other inputs?

select.label: E5. If yes, which inputs do you trade?

input.label: E6. If you are trading other inputs than feed, what is your total transaction cost per month?
E7. What is your total turnover per month?

select1.label: F1. Do you have your own means of transport for this business?

group.label: G1. How many employees do you have?

input.label: G3. For how long did you employ her/him?
G6. If you provide food and drinks, indicate the average birr equivalent per month
Section H: Future Plans and business constraints
H1. How many other men traders are conducting a similar business in this town?
H1. How many other women traders are conducting a similar business in this town?

group.label: Section H: Future Plans and business constraints

select1.label: H2. How have the following changed over the last 5 years?
a. Volume of inputs handled by such suppliers
e. Number of suppliers doing similar business of similar scale in this town
H3. Did you expand your business during the last 12 months?
H5. Do you plan to expand the volume of your business during the next 12 months?
H6. What are the reasons for expansion?

item.label: increased demand for products supplied by the business
policy environment more conducive to business
farmers get more support from government services or NGOs

select1.label: H7. If no, indicate the reasons why no plan of expansion

item.label: demand for inputs and/ or services stagnant

select.label: H8. What do you view as the 3 most important CONSTRAINTS to your business in order of importance?

item.label: few farmers are aware of the inputs being offered
few farmers are willing or able to pay for the inputs being offered
livestock production is too variable/ seasonality in production
small size of farmer’s herds/ flocks
inputs for the business are not widely available
inputs for the business are too costly
lack of storage and/or high storage costs

select1.label: I1. Are you a member of an association related to your business?

select.label: I2. If yes, what are the benefits that you derive from membership?

item.label: Better access to timely market information

select.label: I3.What are the costs of membership?

group.label: I4: Do you collaborate with other input suppliers on:

select1.label: Do you collaborate with other input suppliers on
2. Providing large product volumes to specific buyers
3. Agreeing on prices paid or areas served

group.label: What is the SINGLE most important constraint to

select1.label: J1. What is the SINGLE most important constraint to

item.label: Making more Profit from your feed supply business
poor product quality in the market
unavailability of some of the products (inputs)
the inconvenience with the government policies
poor awareness of farmers about the inputs (concentrate feeds)

select1.label: J2. What is the SINGLE most important opportunity to:1. Make more profit from your feed supply business?

item.label: Better awareness of users about the products and services

input.label: Section K: Responses to opportunities
input.hint: Use the forward arrow button to continue

input.label: K1. What should be done to overcome the constraints?
K1. What has been already tried?
K2.What should be done to exploit opportunities?
K3. What has been already tried to exploit the opportunities?
Survey End: Kindly confirm survey completion and end of survey time.
input.hint: Use the forward arrow button to continue

select1.label: Enumerator:I confirm that this questionnaire is complete.
